name: Qalam Education Fund
mission:
Inspiring growth through nurturing education built on a sacred foundation.

We envision a community that thrives off of accessible Islamic knowledge and...
theoryOfChange: Inspiring growth through a three-pronged approach: Ta'leem (Learning), Tarbiya (Personal growth), and Suhba (Mentorship) to transform individuals into better people in line with Prophetic personality.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.qalam.institute/zakat (Source: https://www.qalam.institute/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc shows strong alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.qalam.institute/zakat (Source: https://www.qalam.institute/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 81.2% and 109.7 months of working capital.
Qalam Education Fund Inc is Zakat-eligible and maintains specific policies for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,338,320 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
Qalam operates the Qalam Seminary and Alimiyyah Program to provide nurturing education.
The organization focuses on community growth and accessible Islamic knowledge.
The charity provides various donation options and giving methods for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with Muslim donor needs, balanced by a need for more direct impact evidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data to verify long-term educational outcomes
Data confidence is currently medium, suggesting a need for more transparent public reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: Qalam shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible institution that addresses the urgent global need for Islamic education [2][8]. Its track record is established through diverse programming, including the Qalam Podcast and intensive seminary courses, which resonate with a high donor fit [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to its mission by directing 81.2% of its expenses toward programs like the Qalam Seminary and Alimiyyah Program [1][4]. While financial health is robust with 109.7 months of working capital, the impact score reflects a focus on capacity building where direct cost-per-beneficiary data is not yet fully standardized [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred foundation of nurturing education and community growth.
strengths: Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong program expense ratio of 81.2% ensuring funds reach core educational initiatives
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for asnaf distribution
baseline_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering a community that thrives on accessible Islamic knowledge through its seminary and digital outreach [4][5]. The organization reported a total revenue of $2,338,320 and maintains a high level of financial stability with 109.7 months of working capital [1][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with Muslim donor needs, balanced by a need for more direct impact evidence.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="1">109.7 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, which could be deployed more actively into mission delivery.
The organization currently has a very small board, which presents a governance risk.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets 13 of 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains strong financial efficiency despite these structural concerns.
risk_factors: Excessive working capital of <cite id="1">109.7 months</cite>
Small board size of only 2 members
case_against.summary: The primary concerns relate to governance and capital deployment.

confidence.notes: Data confidence is medium due to missing impact metrics.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could expand its board size and improve transparency reporting.

impact.improvement: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.

rich_narrative.headline: Qalam Education Fund Inc provides accessible Islamic knowledge through a sacred foundation of nurturing education and community growth.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support accessible Islamic education and digital outreach initiatives with zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations while supporting Islamic education
Support capacity building and knowledge dissemination
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate humanitarian relief or those who prefer organizations with lean financial reserves.

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real educational impact.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by exceptional fundraising efficiency and extensive digital reach.

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring maximum donor impact.
Qalam dedicates <cite id="3">81.2% of its expenses</cite> to core educational initiatives.
The organization <cite id="2">accepts Zakat</cite> with clear distribution policies for eligible categories.

strengths_deep_dive: Qalam Education Fund Inc demonstrates exceptional financial efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization directs <cite id="3">81.2% of its expenses</cite> toward its core mission of providing accessible Islamic knowledge. Furthermore, Qalam is <cite id="2">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, ensuring that Zakat funds are distributed appropriately to eligible categories such as fuqara and masakin.
rich_narrative.summary: Qalam Education Fund Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering a community that thrives on accessible Islamic knowledge through its seminary and digital outreach. The organization reported <cite id="3">$2,338,320 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Qalam operates multiple educational initiatives, including the Qalam Seminary, Qalam Podcast, and Alimiyyah Program. The organization maintains <cite id="1">109.7 months of working capital</cite> and demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of <cite id="1">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Qalam is <cite id="2">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, accepting Zakat for categories such as fuqara and masakin.
